ja23:1.1: A wounded warhouse urges its rider to take one last stand.
ja23:1.3: Bhoja is a common name or term for a king. The commentary says the bhojja was a stallion from Sindh (today a province of Pakistan). | Vaḷavā is normally “mare”, but here it is masculine ablative, glossed with the masculine khaluṅkasso (“wild colt”, see AN 8.14:9.1). It is said to be not from Sindh. Monier-Williams defines vaḍaba as “a male horse resembling a mare”, perhaps a gelding.
